ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50g dark chocolate"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"60ml coffee-flavoured liqueur"},{"ingredients":"60ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"60ml Irish cream liqueur"},{"ingredients":"100ml double cream"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put two small tumblers in the fridge to chill overnight. Put 30g of the chocolate in a shallow bowl and melt in the microwave in short bursts. Dip the rim of the chilled glasses in the melted chocolate, then stand them upright so it gradually drips down the sides. Return to the fridge until you're ready to serve."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then pour in the coffee-flavoured liqueur, vodka, Irish cream liqueur and double cream. Shake until the outside of the shaker is very cold."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Put a few ice cubes in the prepared glasses, then strain in the cocktail. Finely grate over the remaining chocolate and serve with a paper straw."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g pecans , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"160g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp sea salt flakes"},{"ingredients":"Reyka vodka"},{"ingredients":"3 egg whites"},{"ingredients":"120ml fresh clementine juice (about 2-3 clementines)"},{"ingredients":"18 drops chocolate bitters (we used Fee brothers Aztec chocolate bitters)"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"6 dehydrated orange slices , to serve"},{"ingredients":"good grating of nutmeg , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Toast the pecans in a dry saucepan for 1-2 mins, then take off the heat. Quickly add the sugar and 80ml water, stir rapidly to dissolve the sugar, add the salt, then leave the mixture to cool completely. Pour through a sieve to remove the pecans."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour the pecan salted caramel syrup, vodka, egg whites, clementine juice and bitters into a cocktail shaker. Shake hard for 30 secs to add volume to the egg white. Add some ice and shake again for a further 15 secs, then strain into rocks or coupe glasses. Garnish each with a dehydrated orange slice and grate fresh nutmeg over, to taste. Serve immediately."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"½ lime"},{"ingredients":"50ml rum , we used white rum"},{"ingredients":"100ml cola"},{"ingredients":"ice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cut ½ a lime into four small wedges. Squeeze the juice from two of the wedges into a tall glass. Drop the remaining wedges into the glass and fill with ice. Pour in the rum then fill up with cola and stir gently."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"small handful ice"},{"ingredients":"200ml tomato juice"},{"ingredients":"50ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp amontillado sherry"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp sherry vinegar , or to taste"},{"ingredients":"pinch celery salt"},{"ingredients":"Worcestershire sauce , to taste"},{"ingredients":"Tabasco , to taste"},{"ingredients":"squeeze of lemon juice"},{"ingredients":"celery sticks and lemon wedges, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the ice in a tall glass. Pour over the tomato juice, vodka, amontillado and sherry vinegar. Stir in the celery salt, then season to taste with the Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco and lemon juice. Taste again to see if more sherry vinegar is needed."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Serve with celery sticks, lemon wedges and a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"50ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"25ml peach schnapps"},{"ingredients":"2 oranges, juiced, plus 2 slices to garnish"},{"ingredients":"50ml cranberry juice"},{"ingredients":"glacé cherries, to garnish (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Fill two tall glasses with ice cubes. Pour the vodka, peach schnapps and fruit juices into a large jug and stir."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Divide the mixture between the two glasses and stir gently to combine. Garnish with the cocktail cherries and orange slices."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"60ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp dry vermouth"},{"ingredients":"olive or lemon peel, to garnish"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Stir the vodka, dry vermouth and a little ice together or put them in a cocktail shaker to combine."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Strain into a chilled martini glass. Serve with an olive on a cocktail stick or a twist of lemon peel."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"120ml pineapple juice"},{"ingredients":"60ml white rum"},{"ingredients":"60ml coconut cream"},{"ingredients":"wedge of pineapple, to garnish (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pulse all the ingredients along with a handful of ice in a blender until smooth. Pour into a tall glass and garnish as you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200ml Pimm's No. 1"},{"ingredients":"600ml lemonade"},{"ingredients":"mint sprigs, sliced cucumber, sliced orange and strawberries, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Fill a jug with ice and pour over the Pimm’s and lemonade. Give it a good stir then add the mint, cucumber and fruit."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50ml dark rum"},{"ingredients":"50ml white rum"},{"ingredients":"1 passion fruit"},{"ingredients":"1 orange , juiced"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon , juiced"},{"ingredients":"50ml sugar syrup"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp grenadine"},{"ingredients":"4 cocktail cherries"},{"ingredients":"2 orange slices"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Fill a cocktail shaker with ice then add the rums. Scoop the flesh and seeds from the passion fruit and add to the shaker along with the orange and lemon juices, sugar syrup and grenadine."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Shake well until the outside of the cocktail shaker feels icy cold. Fill two hurricane glasses with fresh ice then double strain the drink into the prepared glasses."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Garnish each one with an orange slice skewered onto a cocktail stick and a couple of cocktail cherries."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50ml bourbon or rye whiskey"},{"ingredients":"25ml rosso vermouth"},{"ingredients":"5ml syrup from a jar of maraschino cherries (we used Luxardo)"},{"ingredients":"2 dashes Angostura bitters"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"maraschino cherry"},{"ingredients":"a twist of pared lemon"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Stir the ingredients with ice in a mixing glass, then strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g strawberries , hulled and halved"},{"ingredients":"50g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp rosewater"},{"ingredients":"chilled bottle of Champagne or prosecco"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Blitz the strawberries with the sugar and rosewater in a blender or small food processor to form a purée. Add a spoon or two to each glass, then top up with your choice of chilled bubbly."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 ripe passion fruits (they should have a crinkly appearance), halved"},{"ingredients":"60ml vanilla vodka"},{"ingredients":"30ml passoa"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp lime juice"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp sugar syrup"},{"ingredients":"prosecco , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Scoop the seeds from one of the passion fruits into the glass of a cocktail shaker, add the vodka, passoa, lime juice and sugar syrup. Add a handful of ice and shake well, strain into 2 martini glasses, top up with prosecco, then add half a passion fruit to each. Serve immediately."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"175ml chilled blood orange juice"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp orange blossom water"},{"ingredients":"chilled champagne or  prosecco"},{"ingredients":"salted almonds and olives , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Mix together orange juice and orange blossom water, then divide between 6 cocktail glasses. Top up with champagne or prosecco and serve with nibbles like olives and salted almonds."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"large handful of ice"},{"ingredients":"100ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"500ml tomato juice"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp lemon juice, plus 2 slices to serve"},{"ingredients":"few shakes Worcestershire sauce"},{"ingredients":"few shakes Tabasco (smoked Tabasco is nice)"},{"ingredients":"pinch celery salt"},{"ingredients":"pinch black pepper"},{"ingredients":"2 celery sticks, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Place the ice in a large jug. Measure the vodka, tomato juice and lemon juice and pour it straight onto the ice."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add 3 shakes of Worcestershire sauce and Tabasco (or more if you like it very spicy) and a pinch of celery salt and pepper. Stir until the outside of the jug feels cold, then strain the cocktail into 2 tall glasses."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Top up with fresh ice, add a celery stick and lemon slice to both glasses and enjoy."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250ml gin"},{"ingredients":"200ml elderflower cordial"},{"ingredients":"1l cloudy apple juice"},{"ingredients":"apple slices and ice, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"In a jam jar, mix gin with cordial. When ready to serve, divide the mixture between 8 glasses, top up with apple juice, apple slices and ice."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"12 gooseberries"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"juice ½ lemon"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp elderflower cordial"},{"ingredients":"chilled sparkling wine , for topping up (we used Prosecco)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tip gooseberries and sugar into a cocktail shaker or large jam jar with a lid. Using the end of a rolling pin, mush the gooseberries and sugar together. Add lemon juice, cordial and 4 ice cubes, pop on the lid and shake well. Strain into glasses and top up with white wine, then stir before serving."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 limes , halved"},{"ingredients":"6 tbsp golden granulated sugar"},{"ingredients":"400g ice"},{"ingredients":"200ml cachaça"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cut each of the lime halves into four chunks. Put in a large mortar with the sugar and squish well with a pestle to break them down – they will release their juices, leaving you with a sweet lime syrup. Remove the lime peel, squeeze to release the last bits of juice, then discard. Transfer the lime syrup to a small plastic container and freeze for at least 4 hrs, ideally overnight."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"When you’re ready to make the cocktail, put the ice in a blender suitable for crushing ice, then add the frozen syrup and cachaça. Blend at a high speed until smooth and thick. Transfer to cocktail glasses or tumblers and serve immediately."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"12 cardamom pods"},{"ingredients":"6 tbsp Seville orange marmalade , plus more to serve"},{"ingredients":"400ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"125ml Cointreau"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp lemon juice"},{"ingredients":"ice , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Bash 6 cardamom pods in a pestle and mortar until they split."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Melt the marmalade in a pan, then whisk in the vodka. Add the crushed pods. Don’t boil the mix, simply warm it for a few mins. Leave to infuse off the heat for 20 mins, then strain."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add the Cointreau and lemon juice and chill (or keep in the freezer). Serve in glasses with a little more marmalade in the bottom, ice and a cardamom pod floating on top."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g strawberries, hulled"},{"ingredients":"200g ice"},{"ingredients":"100ml rum"},{"ingredients":"juice ½ lime"},{"ingredients":"1 strawberry, halved"},{"ingredients":"2 slices of limes"},{"ingredients":"2 cocktail sticks"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Blend the strawberries then push the resulting puree through a sieve to remove some of the seeds. Tip the sieved puree into the blender again and add the ice, rum and lime juice. Blend again and divide the mixture between 2 Martini glasses."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Thread the lime slices and strawberry halves onto the cocktail sticks and place onto the edge of the glass, serve immediately."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50ml vanilla vodka"},{"ingredients":"50ml London dry gin"},{"ingredients":"50ml reposado tequila"},{"ingredients":"50ml rum"},{"ingredients":"50ml triple sec"},{"ingredients":"50-100ml fresh lime juice"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"500ml cola"},{"ingredients":"2 limes, cut into wedges"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pour the vodka, gin, tequila, rum and triple sec into a large (1.5l) jug, and add lime juice to taste. Half fill the jug with ice, then stir until the outside feels cold."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the cola then stir to combine. Drop in the lime wedges."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Fill 4 tall glasses with more ice cubes and pour in the iced tea."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500ml peach purée or peach nectar"},{"ingredients":"1 bottle prosecco"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the peach puree in a Champagne flute up to about 1/3 full and slowly top up with Prosecco."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 blood oranges , quartered"},{"ingredients":"120ml Grand Marnier"},{"ingredients":"1 star anise"},{"ingredients":"4 tsp tequila"},{"ingredients":"prosecco or champagne, to top up"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Soak the blood oranges (skin on) in 100ml Grand Marnier for 3 hrs."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6 and tip the oranges, along with the soaking liquid, into a small roasting tin or ovenproof dish. Roast in the oven with the star anise for 30-40 mins or until the orange skins start to caramelise. Remove the skins and star anise, and purée the pulp in a food processor until smooth. Strain through a fine mesh sieve and chill until needed."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Mix 25ml of the purée with 1 tsp each of tequila and Grand Marnier per cocktail, and top with Prosecco or champagne to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"25ml coffee liqueur"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"1 maraschino cherry"},{"ingredients":"cola  to top up, chilled (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the vodka and the coffee liqueur into a tumbler filled with ice and stir gently for 30 secs - 1min. Add the cherry and serve. Top with a splash of chilled cola if you prefer a longer drink."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tsp grenadine"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"50ml tequila"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp triple sec"},{"ingredients":"1 large orange, or 2 small ones, juiced"},{"ingredients":"½ lemon, juiced"},{"ingredients":"1 cocktail cherry"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pour the grenadine into the base of a tall glass and set aside. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add the tequila, triple sec and fruit juices. Shake until the outside of the shaker feels cold."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add a few ice cubes to the serving glass then carefully double strain the cocktail into it, trying not to disturb the grenadine layer too much. Add more ice if needed to fill the glass then garnish with a cherry on a stick or cocktail umbrella."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2large limes"},{"ingredients":"100g watermelon"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp gin"},{"ingredients":"tonic  water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cut the limes into 16 pieces. Squeeze 2 pieces of lime into each of the 8 glasses, then drop in the squeezed flesh. Chop the watermelon and divide among the glasses, and throw in some ice cubes. Pour gin over each and top up with chilled tonic water."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50ml sloe gin"},{"ingredients":"25ml lemon juice"},{"ingredients":"25ml gin"},{"ingredients":"ice (crushed and cubes)"},{"ingredients":"100g white caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp juniper berries"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Start by making the juniper syrup. Put the sugar in a small saucepan, then add 100ml water and the juniper berries. Bring to the boil, then take off the heat and gently squash the berries in the liquid using a potato masher. Leave to steep until completely cold, then strain into a sterilised bottle or jar. Will keep in the fridge for up to 2 weeks."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Put the sloe gin, lemon juice, gin and 2 tsp of the syrup in a cocktail shaker with a few ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a tumbler filled with crushed ice. Serve immediately."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"25ml peach schnapps"},{"ingredients":"100ml cranberry juice"},{"ingredients":"few drops fresh lime juice"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"wedge of lime"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Fill a cocktail shaker with ice then add the vodka, peach schnapps, cranberry juice and a few drops of lime juice. Shake really well then strain into a tumbler with extra ice. Garnish with a wedge of lime."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"85g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp fresh  lemon juice"},{"ingredients":"1 bottle of  chilled, sparkling wine  (Cava is a good choice)"},{"ingredients":"20g/1oz pack fresh mint"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the sugar and lemon juice in a small pan and heat gently to dissolve the sugar. Simmer for 2 minutes to make a syrup. Remove from the heat and leave to cool. This can be made in advance and kept in the fridge for up to a week."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"To serve, pour the lemon syrup into 6 champagne flutes or tall glasses, top up each glass with the chilled sparkling wine, then stir quickly to mix before serving with mint sprigs tucked in the top."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"125ml lemon juice"},{"ingredients":"50g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"250ml elderflower liqueur (we used St Germain)"},{"ingredients":"250ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"500ml apple juice (Bradley is best if you like it sharp)"},{"ingredients":"125ml sparkling water"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"fresh summer herbs like lemon verbena, mint and basil (optional)"},{"ingredients":"lemon slices (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"In a bowl, mix the lemon juice and sugar until the sugar dissolves. Transfer into a large serving bowl, add the other liquid ingredients, fill to the top with ice and stir gently. Serve immediately, with herbs and lemon slices, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50ml tequila"},{"ingredients":"25ml triple sec (we used Cointreau)"},{"ingredients":"25ml lime juice"},{"ingredients":"15ml sugar syrup (see 'Goes well with' below)"},{"ingredients":"large handful of ice"},{"ingredients":"wedge of lime , to garnish"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put all the ingredients except the lime wedge in a blender and blitz until smooth. Tip into a cocktail, margarita or rocks glass, garnish and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50ml rye whiskey"},{"ingredients":"25ml lemon juice"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp maple syrup"},{"ingredients":"dash  orange bitters"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp egg white"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"20ml red wine"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pour the whiskey, lemon juice, maple syrup and bitters into a cocktail shaker. Stir the egg white with a fork to loosen it, then add it to the shaker. Shake really well to froth up the egg white. Add a good handful of ice and shake again."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Once the outside of the shaker is really cold, double strain into a glass filled with ice."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Slowly pour the red wine on top and leave to settle for a few moments – the wine will rise to just under the frothy egg white."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 thyme sprigs , leaves only"},{"ingredients":"2 rosemary sprigs, leaves only"},{"ingredients":"8 edible flowers (such as pansies, rose petals and borage)"},{"ingredients":"50ml elderflower cordial"},{"ingredients":"150ml elderflower liqueur"},{"ingredients":"150ml gin"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"330ml can sparkling water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pop the herbs and flowers into the holes of an ice cube tray, fill with water and freeze for 2-3 hrs or until frozen solid."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour the elderflower cordial, elderflower liqueur, gin and a large handful of ice cubes into a large jug. Stir until the outside of the jug feels cold then strain into 4 tall glasses or champagne flutes. Top with the soda and add a few more ice cubes and the floral ones too. Serve immediately."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"400ml cloudy apple juice"},{"ingredients":"200ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"juice 2 lemons"},{"ingredients":"750ml prosecco"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"1 green apple , cored and finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon , sliced"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pour the apple juice, vodka and lemon juice into a punch bowl and chill for 1-2 hrs."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"When you’re ready to serve add the prosecco, ice and apple and lemon slices to garnish."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"25ml coconut rum"},{"ingredients":"50ml coconut water"},{"ingredients":"juice of ½ lime"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"50ml prosecco"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the coconut rum, coconut water and lime juice into a cocktail shaker, add ice and shake until the outside of the shaker is icy-cold to the touch. Strain into a chilled coupe glass, top with the Prosecco and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp good loose-leaf Earl Grey tea"},{"ingredients":"700ml bottle of decent gin"},{"ingredients":"ice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the Earl Grey tea in a large jug. Pour the gin over and stir with a long-handled spoon for about 45 secs."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Strain the gin through a tea strainer over a funnel back into the bottle. You’ll see small particles of leaf still suspended in the gin. Rinse out the jug and, using a coffee filter or some muslin inside the funnel, strain the gin a second time to remove all the particles. In this way, the gin will be stable and the flavour won’t change – it’ll be good for months and months until the final sip."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To serve, shake or stir over ice – I like how the flavours change as the drink dilutes."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 Galia melon"},{"ingredients":"juice 1 lemon"},{"ingredients":"100ml Pimm's"},{"ingredients":"50ml orange liqueur (we used Cointreau)"},{"ingredients":"750ml white wine"},{"ingredients":"½ cucumber , sliced"},{"ingredients":"small bunch mint"},{"ingredients":"300ml sparkling water or sparkling wine"},{"ingredients":"ice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cut the melon in half and scoop out and discard the seeds. Using a melon baller cut the fruit into spheres and place in a large punch bowl. Add the lemon juice, Pimm's, orange liqueur and white wine then chill in the fridge for 1-2 hrs."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"To serve, add the cucumber pieces, mint sprigs and top with sparkling water and ice."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 chamomile tea bag"},{"ingredients":"100ml pink gin"},{"ingredients":"100ml spiced rum"},{"ingredients":"100ml elderflower cordial"},{"ingredients":"100ml pink grapefruit juice"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"thyme sprigs, to garnish"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Brew the chamomile tea bag with 500ml boiling water, steep for 2-3 mins or following pack instructions. Remove the bag and leave to cool for 5 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour into a large jug with the pink gin, rum, elderflower cordial and juice. Add ice and stir, then add the thyme sprigs and stir again before serving."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"10 cm piece of cucumber"},{"ingredients":"100ml elderflower cordial"},{"ingredients":"100ml gin"},{"ingredients":"1l bottle tonic water , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Peel 2 long strips from the piece of cucumber and put in a small tupperware for transporting. Grate the remaining cucumber into a sieve set over a bowl and press down on it with the back of a spoon to extract as much juice as possible. Add the elderflower cordial and gin to the cucumber juice and put in a bottle ready for travelling. At your picnic, wind the strips of cucumber around inside 2 glasses, pour in a quarter of the cucumber gin mixture, and top up with with a quarter of the bottle of tonic water to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50ml homemade lime syrup (see recipe, below) or lime cordial"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"50ml London dry gin"},{"ingredients":"slice of lime and an edible flower, to garnish (optional)"},{"ingredients":"2 limes , grated zest and juice"},{"ingredients":"200g caster sugar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put a martini or coupe glass in the fridge to chill."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour 50ml of the lime syrup (see recipe, below) or cordial into a jug or tall glass and add a few ice cubes and the gin. Stir until the outside of the container feels very cold."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Strain the mixture into your chilled glass and garnish with a slice of lime and an edible flower."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"For the homemade lime syrup, put the lime zest into a saucepan. Squeeze the juice from both limes into a measuring jug – stop when you get to about 60ml, then top it up with water so you have 100ml of liquid in total. Pour this into your pan with the caster sugar. Heat very gently, stirring occasionally just until the sugar has dissolved, but don’t let it boil. Strain the mixture into a heatproof jug and leave to cool. Makes 280-300ml. Lasts up to two weeks."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50ml cognac"},{"ingredients":"25ml triple sec"},{"ingredients":"25ml lemon juice"},{"ingredients":"handful of ice"},{"ingredients":"dash of Angostura bitters (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put a coupe glass in the fridge to chill. Tip all of the ingredients into a cocktail shaker."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Shake well, until the outside of the shaker feels cold, then strain the cocktail into the chilled glass. If the lemon juice is too sharp, add the bitters to taste."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 large cucumber , peeled and chopped into small chunks"},{"ingredients":"small bunch mint , leaves picked"},{"ingredients":"500ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"juice 6 lime , plus wedges to serve"},{"ingredients":"200g white caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"1-2 small melons (we used 1/2 honeydew, 1/2 cantaloupe and 1/2 watermelon)"},{"ingredients":"1l sparkling water , chilled"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the cucumber and half the mint in a large bowl or jug, and pour over the vodka. Cover and leave to steep for at least 24 hrs or for up to 1 week in the fridge, stirring every few days. Strain through a fine sieve."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour the vodka, lime juice and sugar into a larger jug. Stir well."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Using a melon baller, scoop out as many melon balls as you can. Add them to the jug and leave to steep for 30 mins-1 hr in the fridge. Top up with sparkling water and add the remaining mint leaves just before serving with extra lime wedges."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g/4oz light muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 star anise"},{"ingredients":"1 cinnamon stick"},{"ingredients":"4 cloves"},{"ingredients":"150ml water"},{"ingredients":"1 lemon"},{"ingredients":"2 clementines"},{"ingredients":"150ml Cointreau"},{"ingredients":"750ml/ 1¼pint bottle light red wine , such as Beaujolais"},{"ingredients":"Twist of orange zest and a star anise, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put 100g light muscovado sugar in a pan with 1 star anise, 1 cinnamon stick, 4 cloves and 150ml water. Bring slowly to the boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Simmer for 2 mins, then pour into a large jug and leave to cool. Add 1 lemon and 2 clementines, both thinly sliced, to the jug along with 150ml Cointreau and a 750ml bottle light red wine, such as a Beaujolais. Stir well, then cover and chill for at least 2 hrs or overnight if you can."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Serve chilled or over ice, with a twist of orange zest and a star anise. If you’d like to serve a traditional warm mulled wine, there’s no need to chill – simply warm through without boiling and serve in heatproof glasses."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"60ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp Kahlúa"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp cream"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Mix together all the ingredients. Put some ice cubes in a small tumbler and pour the cocktail over the top."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 limes , chopped into wedges, plus extra lime wedges to serve (optional)"},{"ingredients":"6 tbsp golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"200ml cachaça"},{"ingredients":"few handfuls crushed ice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the lime wedges in a large jug with the sugar, then use a muddler or the end of a rolling pin to break them down. Release as much juice from the wedges as possible, and let it mix with the sugar to create a syrup – you can also do this with a large pestle and mortar. Discard the lime peel."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Divide the syrup and cachaça between four glasses, then top with the crushed ice. Serve garnished with lime wedges, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50g pineapple pieces"},{"ingredients":"50g chopped mango"},{"ingredients":"3 limes , chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp light brown soft sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 mint sprigs , leaves picked"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"150ml white rum"},{"ingredients":"200ml pineapple rum"},{"ingredients":"600ml sparkling water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tip the pineapple, mango, limes and sugar into a large jug and muddle together. Bruise and add the mint leaves, then top with ice. Stir in the white rum, pineapple rum and sparkling water."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g cranberry"},{"ingredients":"100ml/3½fl oz cranberry juice"},{"ingredients":"500ml blood  orange juice (Sanguinello)"},{"ingredients":"juice of 1 lime"},{"ingredients":"thin wedges of lime"},{"ingredients":"thin wedges of orange"},{"ingredients":"mint  sprigs"},{"ingredients":"600ml Appletise, sparkling  apple juice  drink"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the cranberries into a medium size, rigid freezer container, cover with water (by about 2.5cm), freeze until solid."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Mix the cranberry juice in a large jug (about 1.5 litre) with the orange and lime juices."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To serve, smash the sheet of frozen cranberries into shards and put in the bottom of eight highball glasses. Put a wedge of lime and orange and a mint sprig in each glass, then pour in the mixed fruit juices and top up with Appletise."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"9-10 strawberries"},{"ingredients":"2 limes , chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp granulated sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 mint sprigs , leaves picked"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"350ml white rum"},{"ingredients":"600ml sparkling water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Muddle the strawberries, limes and sugar in a large jug. Bruise the mint leaves and add to the jug with a pinch of black pepper. Add lots of ice and stir in the rum and sparkling water."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200ml pink grapefruit juice"},{"ingredients":"100ml gin"},{"ingredients":"½ small bunch thyme"},{"ingredients":"50ml Campari"},{"ingredients":"25ml red vermouth"},{"ingredients":"750ml rosé wine"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp honey , plus more to taste"},{"ingredients":"ice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put all the ingredients together in a punch bowl, add lots of ice, stir gently and serve immediately."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp white  rum"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp dark rum"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp triple sec"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp grenadine"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp orgeat or almond syrup (we used Monin almond syrup, available online)"},{"ingredients":"juice of half a  lime"},{"ingredients":"maraschino cherry"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Stir all the ingredients together in a jug or shake them in a cocktail shaker. Put a few cubes of ice in a tumbler, pour over the liquid and garnish with a cherry."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"300ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"24 mint leaves"},{"ingredients":"seeds from 1 pomegranate (about 1 heaped tsp per glass)"},{"ingredients":"600ml apple juice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Fill six highball or big wine glasses with ice and divide 300ml vodka between them. Add 24 mint leaves, seeds from 1 pomegranate (about 1 heaped tsp per glass) and 600ml apple juice, then stir with a straw or chopstick to muddle."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200ml/7fl oz each vodka and Cointreau"},{"ingredients":"600ml cranberry juice"},{"ingredients":"400ml orange juice"},{"ingredients":"strips of peel from 2-3 limes"},{"ingredients":"crushed ice , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Pour the vodka and Cointreau into a jug, then add the cranberry juice and orange juice. Stir well."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pare strips of peel from 2-3 limes. Fill 12 glasses with the crushed ice, then pour over the cocktail. Finish each glass with a strip of lime peel."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"35ml pink gin"},{"ingredients":"25ml rose vermouth , or sweet white vermouth"},{"ingredients":"15ml Aperol"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"wedge of pink grapefruit and a basil leaf, to garnish"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Combine the pink gin, vermouth and Aperol in a tumbler with a small handful of ice. Stir until the outside of the glass feels cold."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Garnish with a wedge of pink grapefruit and a basil leaf."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 oranges , chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 pears , chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 lemons , 1 chopped, 1 juiced"},{"ingredients":"200g red berries , chopped (we used strawberries and cherries)"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"750ml bottle light red wine"},{"ingredients":"100ml Spanish brandy"},{"ingredients":"300ml sparkling water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the chopped fruit in a bowl and sprinkle over the sugar and cinnamon, then stir to coat. Cover and leave to macerate in the fridge for at least 1 hr, or ideally overnight."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Fill a large jug with ice. Stir the macerated fruit mixture to ensure the sugar is dissolved, then tip into the jug with the wine and brandy. Stir, then top up with the sparkling water and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g blueberries"},{"ingredients":"3 lemons , chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp granulated sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 mint sprigs , leaves picked"},{"ingredients":"350ml white rum"},{"ingredients":"600ml sparkling water"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the blueberries, lemons and sugar in a jug and muddle. Bruise the mint leaves and add them to the jug with lots of ice. Pour over the rum and sparkling water and stir together."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"25ml dark rum"},{"ingredients":"25ml tequila"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"ginger beer"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp freshly brewed espresso"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Fill a highball glass with ice and pour in the rum and tequila. Stir then top with ginger beer. Slowly pour in the espresso."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1kg pink rhubarb stalks"},{"ingredients":"400g caster sugar (don't use golden - it muddies the colour)"},{"ingredients":"800ml gin"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Wash the rhubarb, trim the stalks and discard the base and any leaves. Cut the stalks into 3cm lengths. Put in a large jar with the sugar. Shake everything around, put the lid on and leave overnight. The sugar will draw the juice out of the rhubarb."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"After 24 hrs, add the gin, seal and shake everything around. Leave for about 4 weeks before drinking. You can strain the liquor off through a muslin-lined sieve and transfer to a bottle, but I often just leave the rhubarb and booze in the jar and ladle it into drinks that way. Over time the rhubarb and the gin go a much paler colour – this doesn’t look as dramatic. The upside is you that have to get through it fairly quickly!"}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 small pineapple"},{"ingredients":"juice 4  limes"},{"ingredients":"bunch fresh mint"},{"ingredients":"8 tbsp golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"400ml cachaça liqueur, or light rum"},{"ingredients":"crushed  ice for 8 glasses"},{"ingredients":"800ml pineapple juice"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Core the pineapple and cut into 3cm chunks. Place 8 small handfuls of pineapple, the lime juice, half the mint and the sugar into a pitcher and mash up with the end of a rolling pin or a fat wooden spoon."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in the cachaça and a little crushed ice, then pour into 8 glasses, and add more crushed ice. Pour the pineapple juice over, filling to the rim. Garnish the glasses with extra mint sprigs and cocktail sticks with pieces of pineapple threaded on."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"300g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"12 mint leaves"},{"ingredients":"6 limes , juiced"},{"ingredients":"1 bergamot , zested and juiced (available from ocado.com)"},{"ingredients":"150ml golden rum"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Mix the sugar with 1 ltr water in a medium saucepan. Bring to the boil, then cool to room temperature."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Blend the mint, lime juice and bergamot zest and juice in a food processor, then add the cooled syrup and blend until combined. Pour into a plastic container and freeze, stirring with a fork every 30 mins until frozen."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To serve, scoop the granita into chilled glasses and pour the rum over."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"100ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"50ml freshly brewed espresso coffee"},{"ingredients":"50ml coffee liqueur (we used Kahlua)"},{"ingredients":"4 coffee beans (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Start by making the sugar syrup. Put the caster sugar in a small pan over a medium heat and pour in 50ml water. Stir, and bring to the boil."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Turn off the heat and allow the mixture to cool. Put 2 martini glasses in the fridge to chill."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Once the sugar syrup is cold, pour 1 tbsp into a cocktail shaker along with a handful of ice, the vodka, espresso and coffee liqueur. Shake until the outside of the cocktail shaker feels icy cold."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Strain into the chilled glasses. Garnish each one with coffee beans if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tsp sugar syrup or 1 tsp granulated sugar"},{"ingredients":"1-2 dashes Angostura bitters"},{"ingredients":"splash of water"},{"ingredients":"60ml Scotch whisky or bourbon"},{"ingredients":"soda water (optional)"},{"ingredients":"orange slice"},{"ingredients":"maraschino cherry (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the sugar, bitters and water in a small tumbler. Mix until the sugar dissolves if using granulated. Fill your glass with ice and stir in the whisky. Add a splash of soda water if you like and mix. Garnish with the orange and cherry."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"85g caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"300g chopped rhubarb"},{"ingredients":"100ml vodka"},{"ingredients":"100ml rhubarb syrup (see above)"},{"ingredients":"1 length rhubarb"},{"ingredients":"30ml advocaat"},{"ingredients":"75ml lemonade"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"To make the rhubarb syrup, put the caster sugar in a saucepan with 75ml water. Heat very gently, so the sugar disappears but the water doesn’t bubble. Tip in the chopped rhubarb, cover with a tight-fitting lid and increase the heat a little so it begins to boil. Simmer, covered, for about 5 mins until the rhubarb is very tender but not disintegrating."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Turn off the heat, and tip the pan’s contents into a fine sieve over a bowl. Use a wooden spoon to gently squeeze the rhubarb so that you get all the juices, but no pulp. Tip back into the pan and boil rapidly for a few mins until just syrupy. Pour into a jug – you should have about 125ml. Leave to cool completely. Any leftovers will keep in the fridge for up to 1 month."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Chill 4 cocktail glasses with ice or in your freezer. Shake the vodka and 100ml of the rhubarb syrup together with ice until mixed and chilled down. Make small shreds of rhubarb using a vegetable peeler and place into iced water – this will make them curl up."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"In a separate jug, whisk together the advocaat and lemonade with more ice to lighten. Divide the vodka and rhubarb mixture between the glasses, straining through a small sieve to catch the ice."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Carefully pour 25ml of your advocaat mixture into each glass over an upsidedown spoon (the mixture should float on the surface of the vodka syrup mixture). Drain the rhubarb shreds well and use to garnish your cocktails."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 courgette , coarsely grated"},{"ingredients":"juice 2 lemons"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"25ml vermouth"},{"ingredients":"50ml gin"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"mint leaf to garnish"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Mix the courgette with the lemon juice and sugar and leave to steep for 1 hr. In the meantime, place a martini glass in the fridge to chill."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Strain the courgette mixture through a sieve into a jug. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice then add 25ml of the courgette syrup followed by the vermouth and gin. Stir gently a few times then strain into your chilled glass. Garnish with a mint leaf and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"45ml lemon vodka"},{"ingredients":"15ml triple sec"},{"ingredients":"30ml cranberry juice"},{"ingredients":"10ml lime juice"},{"ingredients":"ice"},{"ingredients":"orange zest, or a lime wedge on the rim of the glass."}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Shake ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice and strain into a cocktail glass."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"To make the garnish: hold a 3cm round piece of orange zest about 10cm above your cosmo and very carefully wave it over a lit match or lighter flame. Bend the outer edge of the zest in towards the flame so that the orange oils are released, then drop the zest into your drink."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50ml white rum"},{"ingredients":"25ml lime juice"},{"ingredients":"10ml sugar syrup"},{"ingredients":"ice"}]
method:
[{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Shake all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker and strain into a cocktail glass."},{"method":"Strawberry daiquiri
This cocktail should only be attempted with fruit that’s really ripe and sweet – if the berries are the big, bland variety from the chiller cabinet, the end result will just taste of mush. Allow one large handful of hulled strawberries for each cocktail. Place them in the empty shaker and give them a gentle crush with a muddler or pestle, then add the other ingredients and shake as normal and strain into your cocktail glass. Out of season, you could also make a version of this drink using Funkin strawberry purée which will be almost as good. 
Hemingway’s ‘Papa Doble’ daiquiri
The writer Ernest Hemingway drank at El Floridita in Havana so often they ended up creating a daiquiri recipe especially for him called the Papa Doble, made with a quadruple measure of white rum, lime, grapefruit juice and maraschino liqueur. I don’t think many of us could handle a drink this size – as delicious as it is – so I’ve scaled it back a bit: 50ml white rum, 15ml pink grapefruit juice, 15ml lime juice, 15ml Luxardo maraschino liqueur, 5ml sugar syrup, shaken and strained into a cocktail glass or blended with ice, depending on what you prefer. 
La Terraza’s blue daiquiri
Another place Hemingway liked to drink when he went fishing was a little waterside bar about 10 miles outside Havana called La Terraza. La Terraza’s signature daiquiri is made with blue curaçao, so it’s the colour of a lagoon. You can make one too, simply by substituting 15ml Bols Blue curaçao in a normal daiquiri in place of the sugar syrup. A delicious guilty pleasure on a summer’s day, especially with a cocktail umbrella."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"4 tbsp caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 1½ lemon"},{"ingredients":"750ml bottle   rosé wine"},{"ingredients":"150ml peach schnapps"},{"ingredients":"1 peach , sliced"},{"ingredients":"1⁄2  lemon , sliced"},{"ingredients":"ice cubes"},{"ingredients":"1l  bottle of  soda water  or tonic"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the sugar with the lemon zest and 100ml water until the sugar dissolves. Cool, pour into a jug and add the wine, lemon juice and schnapps."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"When ready to serve add plenty of ice and the fruit and top up with the soda or tonic to taste."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 drops of absinthe (we used Pernod)"},{"ingredients":"30ml rye whiskey (we used Michter’s)"},{"ingredients":"30ml cognac (we used Rémy Martin VSOP)"},{"ingredients":"2 drops of Peychaud’s bitters"},{"ingredients":"5ml sugar syrup"},{"ingredients":"1 strip of lemon peel , to garnish"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put a tumbler in the freezer. When it’s freezing cold, pour in the absinthe, swirl it so it thinly coats the inside of the glass, then tip it away. This is called rinsing."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Stir the remaining ingredients, except the lemon peel garnish, together in a mixing glass, then strain into the prepared tumbler."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Garnish with the lemon peel and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"juice of 1 lime"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp granulated sugar"},{"ingredients":"small handful mint leaves, plus extra sprig to serve"},{"ingredients":"60ml white rum"},{"ingredients":"soda water, to taste"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Muddle the lime juice, sugar and mint leaves in a small jug, crushing the mint as you go – you can use the end of a rolling pin for this. Pour into a tall glass and add a handful of ice."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour over the rum, stirring with a long-handled spoon. Top up with soda water, garnish with mint and serve."}]
